Package com.guardsquare.dexguard.rasp.callback

Interface DetectionReport

@Deprecated public interface DetectionReport
Deprecated.
Instances of implementations of this interface describe the context of triggered RASP checks.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    debugBlockerAttacked()
    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by the debug blocker being attacked.
    boolean
    debugBlockerFailed()
    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by the debug blocker failing to attach.
    long
    getDebugInfo()
    Deprecated.
    Encoded details of the threat.
    boolean
    isAppDebuggable()
    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by the application being debuggable.

    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by the application being hooked.

    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by app tampering.

    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by certificate tampering.

    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by clock tampering.
    boolean
    isDebuggerAttached()
    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by a debugger being attached.
    boolean
    isDeviceRooted()
    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by the device being rooted.
    boolean
    isMemoryTampered()
    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by application memory tampering.
    boolean
    isRunningInEmulator()
    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by the application running in an emulator.
    boolean
    isRunningInVirtualEnvironment()
    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by the application running in a virtual environment.
    boolean
    isSelinuxIntegrity()
    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by SELinux being disabled.
    boolean
    isSignedWithDebugKeys()
    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by the app being signed with debug keys.
    boolean
    isTampered()
    Deprecated.
    Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by a tampering threat: either APK tampering or certificate tampering.

      Deprecated.
      Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by a debugger being attached.

      boolean isRunningInVirtualEnvironment()
      Deprecated.
      Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by the application running in a virtual environment.

      boolean isTampered()
      Deprecated.
      Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by a tampering threat: either APK tampering or certificate tampering.

      boolean isAppTampered()
      Deprecated.
      Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by app tampering.

    • isCertificateTampered

      boolean isCertificateTampered()
      Deprecated.
      Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by certificate tampering.

    • isSignedWithDebugKeys

      boolean isSignedWithDebugKeys()
      Deprecated.
      Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by the app being signed with debug keys.

      boolean isClockTampered()
      Deprecated.
      Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by clock tampering.

    • isMemoryTampered

      boolean isMemoryTampered()
      Deprecated.
      Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by application memory tampering.

      boolean debugBlockerFailed()
      Deprecated.
      Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by the debug blocker failing to attach.

    • debugBlockerAttacked

      boolean debugBlockerAttacked()
      Deprecated.
      Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by the debug blocker being attacked.

    • isSelinuxIntegrity

      boolean isSelinuxIntegrity()
      Deprecated.
      Indicates whether the threat event was triggered by SELinux being disabled.

    • getDebugInfo

      long getDebugInfo()
      Deprecated.
      Encoded details of the threat. It's recommended to log this information, in-case you need to report any problems to Guardsquare support.
